title: A Hydrophobic Tissue Clearing Method for Rat Brain Tissue
procedures:
All animal protocols were reviewed and approved by the Animal Care and Use Committee at the University of South Carolina.
1. Stock solution preparation
Solution 1 (1 L): To 900 mL of deionized H2O add 100 mL of 10x phosphate buffered saline (PBS) and 2 mL of Triton X-100.
Solution 2 (1 L): To 900 mL of deionized H2O, add 100 mL of 10x PBS, 2mL of Tween-20 and 1 mL of 10 mg/mL Heparin stock solution.
Solution 3 (500 mL): To 400 mL of Solution 1, add 11.5 g of glycine and 100 mL of dimethylsulfoxide (DMSO).
Solution 4 (50 mL): To 42 mL of Solution 1, add 3 mL of corresponding serum and 5 mL of DMSO.
Primary antibody solution (50 mL): To 46 mL of Solution 2, add 2.5 mL of DMSO and 1.5 mL of corresponding serum.
Secondary antibody solution (50 mL): To 48.5 mL of Solution 2, add 1.5 mL of corresponding serum.
	NOTE: For Solution 4, primary solution, and secondary solution, use a serum that corresponds with the secondary antibody (e.g., goat, horse, bovine).
2. Sample preparation
NOTE: Perform steps 2.1 through 2.7 in a fume hood due to limit the exposure to PFA.
Deeply anesthetize young (3-6 week) rat using sevoflurane; proceed to 2.2 when rat is not responsive and fails to respond to toe and tail pinch.
Lay the rat in a supine position and make an incision through the abdominal wall using a pair of Iris scissors.
Cut up through the bottom of the rib cage to the collarbone on both sides of the rib cage using Mayo scissors.
Affix the sternum and ribs away from the heart and lungs with a hemostat.

Pierce the left ventricle with a 23 G needle attached to a perfusion pump and cut the right atrium with Iris scissors.
Perform transcardial perfusion with approximately 75 mL of 100 mM (1x) PBS.
Continue transcardial perfusion with approximately 100 mL of 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) buffered in 1x PBS.
Remove the brain from the skull using forceps.
Place the brain in sagittal position and slice into 4 equal sections (approximately 3 mm in width) using a razor blade and a rat brain matrix.
Fix each section in 4% PFA in 1x PBS in a sealed, 5mL plastic tube overnight at 4 °C on a shaker.
Continue to fix in 4% PFA in 1x PBS at room temperature (RT) on a shaker for 1 h.
Wash each section with 1x PBS at RT for 30 min, 3 times.
3. Dehydration and depigmentation
Incubate the sample in a 20% methanol/80% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in a 40% methanol/60% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in a 60% methanol/40% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in an 80% methanol/20% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in 100% methanol for 1 h at RT. Repeat with more 100% methanol, incubating for 1 h at RT.
Chill the sample in 100% methanol at 4° C for approximately 10 min.
Prepare a 66% dichloromethane (DCM)/33% methanol solution.
Incubate the sample overnight in the DCM/methanol solution at RT, with shaking.
Wash with methanol at RT for 30 min, 2 times.
Chill the sample in 100% methanol at 4° C for approximately 10 min.
Bleach in chilled, freshly prepared 5% hydrogen peroxide in methanol overnight at 4° C.

Incubate the sample in an 80% methanol/20% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in a 60% methanol/40% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in a 40% methanol/60% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in a 20% methanol/80% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in 1x PBS for 1 h at RT.
Wash in Solution 1 for 1 h at RT, 2 times.
4. Cholera Toxin Subunit B labeling
Insert needle tip of 1 mL syringe into nucleus accumbens site.
Slowly inject 2.5 μL of 1% biotin-CTB over 20 s.
Leave the needle tip in place for 1 min and remove slowly over 10 s to prevent leakage.
5. Antibody application
Incubate the sample in Solution 3 for 2 days at 37 °C in a water bath.
Incubate the sample in Solution 4 for 2 days at 37 °C in a water bath.
Incubate with primary antibody for 7 days at 37 °C in a water bath.
Wash in Solution 2 for 5 times, incubating 1 h per wash. Store in Solution 2 at RT overnight.
Incubate with secondary antibody for 7 days at 37 °C in water bath.
Wash in Solution 2 for 5 times, incubating 1 h per wash; store in Solution 2 at RT overnight.
	NOTE: All steps from 5.6 onwards, including final storage, should occur in low light. The sample tubes can be shielded with aluminum foil. The concentrations used for the antibodies in this protocol were: TH at 1:100, Iba1 at 1:200, and the secondary antibody at 1:100. Add additional Solution 2 to steps 5.1-5.6 to ensure tubes are completely filled.
6. Tissue clearing

Incubate the sample in a 20% methanol/80% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in a 40% methanol/60% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in a 60% methanol/40% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in an 80% methanol/20% deionized water solution for 1 h at RT.
Incubate the sample in 100% methanol for 1 h at RT.
Incubate in fresh 100% methanol overnight at RT.
Incubate in 66% DCM/33% methanol for 3 h, with shaking, at room temperature.
Incubate in dibenzyl ether (DBE) without shaking. Leave the sample in DBE until clear and store in DBE until imaging.
7. Mounting
Obtain a 3D printed chamber made of Visijet M3 Crystal resin (templates available on the idisco.info website).
Secure the chamber to a microscope slide using an epoxy.
Place the sample in the square space in the middle of the chamber.
Fill the chamber completely with DBE.
Place a 0.17 mm thick coverslip over the chamber and apply pressure until the coverslip has full contact with the chamber walls.
Seal the edges of the coverslip to the chamber using the epoxy.
Rotate the chamber to allow air bubbles to escape from the filling inlet.
Fill the chamber with additional DBE.
Seal the filling inlet with epoxy and allow to cure.
	NOTE: Excess DBE will spill out during mounting.
8. Imaging
Use a confocal microscope system to perform z-scan at 4x magnification (see the attached 3D video).
Achieve fluorescent excitation of the sample using a laser set to emit at a wavelength similar to the wavelength specified by the secondary antibody. TH excitation was achieved utilizing a HeNe laser set to emit at 632 nm.

Set the detector to a wavelength close to the laser emission. For the present protocol, the detector for TH was set to 650 nm.
Raise the gain of the detector until there is a visible signal. The 650LP gain for images was set to 7.50 B.
Using the Scan option in the confocal imaging software, move the microscope stage until the sample is brought into focus.
Navigate around the tissue in all plains and obtain either single images or z-stack images using the confocal imaging software.
Once imaging is completed, remove the sample from the chamber. Place it back into a tube completely filled with DBE and store at RT in a dark place, preferably covered in aluminum foil.
	NOTE: Samples can be remounted and imaged as long as the florescence signal is still strong.
